questions.title: LRU Cache
questions.prompt: Design and implement an LRU cache supporting get and put in O(1) average time.
followups: Why do you need both a hash map and a linked list?
What edge cases would you test (capacity 0/1, updates, repeats)?
How would you make it thread-safe?

questions.title: Top K Frequent Elements
questions.prompt: Given an array of integers, return the k most frequent elements.
followups: Can you do better than sorting?
How do you handle ties deterministically?

questions.title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
questions.prompt: Given a string, find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters.
followups: What invariant does your window maintain?
How would you adapt for Unicode?

questions.title: Merge Intervals
questions.prompt: Given a list of intervals, merge all overlapping intervals.
followups: What tricky edge cases exist (touching endpoints, nested)?

questions.title: Search in Rotated Sorted Array
questions.prompt: Search for a target in a rotated sorted array in O(log n) time.
followups: How do duplicates change the approach?
What edge cases would you test?

questions.title: Product of Array Except Self
questions.prompt: Return an array output where output[i] is the product of all elements except nums[i], without using division.
followups: How do zeros affect the solution?

questions.title: Validate Binary Search Tree
questions.prompt: Given a binary tree, determine if it is a valid BST.

questions.title: Lowest Common Ancestor (Binary Tree)
questions.prompt: Given a binary tree and two nodes, find their lowest common ancestor.
followups: How does it differ for a BST?
What if nodes might not exist in the tree?
How do you avoid recursion depth issues?

questions.title: Design a Rate Limiter (Single Region)
questions.prompt: Design a rate limiter for an API: N requests per minute per user. Provide a workable design and trade-offs.
followups: Fixed window vs sliding window vs token bucket?
How do you avoid retry storms?

questions.title: Design a Queue-Based Worker System
questions.prompt: Design a system where requests are enqueued and processed by workers with retries and dead-letter handling.
followups: How do you monitor stuck jobs?

questions.title: SQL: Top Customers by Spend
questions.prompt: Given tables Orders(user_id, amount, created_at) and Users(id, name), write a query to return top 10 users by total spend in the last 30 days.
followups: What indexes would you add and why?

questions.title: Concurrency: Producer-Consumer
questions.prompt: Explain how you would implement producer-consumer with a bounded buffer safely.
followups: What are condition variables used for?

questions.title: Object Design: Notification Service
questions.prompt: Design classes/interfaces for sending notifications (email/SMS/push) with extensibility and testability.
followups: How do you handle retries and failures?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Deliver Results
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you delivered a result under a tight deadline or constraints.
followups: What did you prioritize and why?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Earn Trust
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you earned trust from teammates or stakeholders.

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Are Right, A Lot
questions.prompt: Tell me about a decision you made with limited data. How did you reason and what happened?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Invent and Simplify
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you simplified a process/system to improve speed or reliability.
followups: How did you prove the simplification worked?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Insist on the Highest Standards
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you raised the quality bar in a project (testing, reviews, performance, security).
followups: How did you bring others along?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Think Big
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you proposed a big improvement or long-term idea beyond immediate requirements.
followups: What was the outcome or next step?

questions.title: Two Sum (Multiple Approaches)
questions.prompt: Given an array of integers and a target sum, find two indices whose values add up to the target.
followups: Compare brute force, hash map, and two-pointer approaches
What if the array is sorted?
How would you handle multiple pairs?

questions.title: Valid Palindrome
questions.prompt: Given a string, determine if it is a palindrome, considering only alphanumeric characters and ignoring cases.
followups: How would you handle spaces and punctuation?
What's the time and space complexity?
Can you solve it with O(1) extra space?

questions.title: Maximum Subarray (Kadane's Algorithm)
questions.prompt: Find the contiguous subarray with the largest sum.
followups: What's the intuition behind Kadane's algorithm?
How would you modify it to also return the subarray indices?
What if all numbers are negative?

questions.title: Implement Queue using Stacks
questions.prompt: Implement a queue using two stacks with efficient operations.
followups: How would you make peek() efficient?
Can you implement a stack using queues?

questions.title: Group Anagrams
questions.prompt: Given an array of strings, group anagrams together.
followups: What makes a good hash key for anagrams?
How would you handle large strings?

questions.title: Container With Most Water
questions.prompt: Given n non-negative integers representing heights, find two lines that together with x-axis form a container holding most water.
followups: Why does the two-pointer approach work?
How would you prove its correctness?

questions.title: 3Sum
questions.prompt: Find all unique triplets in an array that sum to zero.
followups: How do you avoid duplicate triplets?
How would you adapt for a different target sum?

questions.title: Word Break
questions.prompt: Given a string and a dictionary of words, determine if the string can be segmented into space-separated dictionary words.
followups: How would you handle an empty dictionary?

questions.title: Design Hit Counter
questions.prompt: Design a hit counter that counts the number of hits in the past 5 minutes.
followups: How would you handle concurrent hits?
What data structure optimizes for time range queries?
How do you clean up old hits?

questions.title: Design Tic-Tac-Toe
questions.prompt: Design a Tic-Tac-Toe game that supports moves, checking for winners, and handling invalid moves.
followups: How do you check for a win efficiently?
How would you extend to N x N board?

questions.title: Design Parking Lot
questions.prompt: Design a parking lot system with different spot sizes, vehicle types, and pricing.
followups: How do you handle spot assignment?

questions.title: Design URL Shortener (Basic)
questions.prompt: Design a basic URL shortener with key generation and redirection.
followups: How do you generate unique short codes?
How would you scale this design?

questions.title: Design Amazon Product Recommendation
questions.prompt: Design a basic product recommendation system for Amazon.
followups: How would you match users with products?
How do you handle new users or products?

questions.title: Design Shopping Cart (Amazon Context)
questions.prompt: Design a shopping cart system for Amazon with features like add/remove, price calculation, and persistence.
followups: How do you handle concurrent modifications?
What about cart abandonment and recovery?
How do you integrate with inventory and pricing systems?

questions.title: Design Simple Search (Amazon)
questions.prompt: Design a basic search system for Amazon products.

questions.title: SQL: Find Duplicate Products
questions.prompt: Given a products table with name, category, and price, find products with the same name but different prices.
followups: How would you optimize this query?
What if you need to find near-duplicates?
How would you prevent duplicates during insertion?

questions.title: SQL: Customer Order History
questions.prompt: Given orders and customers tables, write a query to find customers who haven't ordered in the last 6 months.
followups: How would you handle large datasets?
What about customers who never ordered?

questions.title: Concurrency: Dining Philosophers
questions.prompt: Explain the dining philosophers problem and how to prevent deadlocks.

questions.title: Concurrency: Read-Write Lock
questions.prompt: Design a read-write lock that allows multiple readers or single writer.
followups: How do you prevent writer starvation?
How would you test this implementation?

questions.title: Object Design: Amazon Payment System
questions.prompt: Design classes for a payment processing system at Amazon.
followups: How would you handle different payment methods?
How do you ensure transaction integrity?

questions.title: Object Design: Inventory Management
questions.prompt: Design classes for Amazon's inventory management system.
followups: How do you track stock levels?
How do you handle restocking alerts?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Customer Obsession
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond to help a customer or user.
followups: How did you identify the customer's need?
How did you measure the impact?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Ownership
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you took ownership of a problem that wasn't originally your responsibility.

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Bias for Action
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you made a quick decision with incomplete information.
followups: What made you decide to act quickly?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Frugality
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you accomplished more with fewer resources.
followups: What constraints were you working under?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Learn and Be Curious
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you learned a new technology or skill to solve a problem.
followups: How did you apply what you learned?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Hire and Develop the Best
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you helped someone else learn or grow.
followups: How did you assess their needs?

questions.title: Behavioral (LP): Success and Scale Bring Broad Responsibility
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you considered the broader impact of your work.
followups: What broader considerations did you have?

questions.title: Behavioral: Conflict Resolution
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you had a disagreement with a teammate and how you resolved it.
followups: How did you approach the conversation?

questions.title: Behavioral: Handling Failure
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you failed at something and what you learned from it.

questions.title: Amazon Innovation Question
questions.prompt: What Amazon product or service would you improve, and how?
followups: Why did you choose this product?
What technical challenges might you face?

questions.title: Technical Trade-offs
questions.prompt: Describe a time you had to make a technical trade-off between performance, scalability, and maintainability.
followups: How did you make your decision?

questions.title: Code Review Experience
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you gave or received constructive feedback during code review.

questions.title: Technical Debt
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you had to deal with technical debt.
followups: How did you identify the debt?
How did you prioritize addressing it?
